title: Overwatch any good?
body: Thinking of buying and running on my crappy laptop..... not sure if I'll like it though. Is it at all similar to TF2? I got sort of bored of that game, but I liked how the maps were pretty big and open.

replies.body:
It's a lot like TF2. You don't have the option to change an individual hero's item/weapons but among the 21 heroes they are significantly different; and they have Ultimates! The game is very polished and they will continue releasing more heroes and maps, so even though it's not free you get a lot of value for $40.

I'd suggest watching some videos or streams of it before you decide.
overwatch is quite fun to be fair. I've only really put time into soldier 76 (simplest all-rounder) but there are a range of toons to play. Big colorful environments.

If your setup isn't good enough I wouldn't bother the game runs at a very high rate and would seem less fun if you were to play on low fps, although it's a very fun change to league but can be quite tilting when there are 5 torbjorns on the other team :/

This article is hated by riot games

> [{quoted}](name=Sulbatamol,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=VIZ8YUQg,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-06-29T06:17:06.513+0000)
>
> This article is hated by riot games

who cares what a shitty company thinks.

it's not worth $70 imo, but it is definitely a fun game. better than league by a longshot.
If it's a really crappy laptop, it won't run at all. My friend downloaded it and it turned out not to work, like he couldn't even open it.

Reaper = Zed
Hanzo = Yasuo
Genji = Yi
Widowmaker = Caitlin 

Those characters are in every game without fail.... Soooo just the same as league then?

BUT (and this is the good part) you can have MULTIPLE Zed's per game, so if you really wanted to, your whole team could go that little shit!

-

apart from crazy repetition of characters it looks alright.
